news.title: Local Market Flooded with Expired Goods
news.summary: Residents report finding expired products on sale at the Sunday market.
news.content: Multiple stalls in the central Sunday market were caught selling expired goods. Local authorities have begun inspections to prevent future incidents.

news.title: City Council Approves New Green Park
news.summary: A new urban park is set to be built in the downtown area by 2026.
news.content: The city council voted unanimously to convert an unused lot into a green park with walking trails, a pond, and a childrenâ€™s playground.

news.title: Schools to Introduce AI Tutors Next Semester
news.summary: Education department plans to integrate AI tutoring into classrooms.
news.content: Starting next semester, public schools will have access to AI-powered tutoring assistants designed to support teachers and provide personalized student feedback.

news.title: Rumors of Free Public Transport Go Viral
news.summary: Social media claims buses and trains will be free next month.
news.content: A viral post suggested the government will make public transport free starting September, but transport officials have denied any such plans.

news.title: Tech Company Launches Affordable Solar Panels
news.summary: A startup unveils cost-effective solar technology aimed at households.
news.content: SolarBright has announced a new line of solar panels that are 30% cheaper than current market options, aiming to boost renewable energy adoption.

news.title: Mystery Animal Spotted in City Park
news.summary: Photos of a strange creature roaming the park have surfaced online.
news.content: Several visitors claim to have seen an unknown animal in Greenleaf Park. Experts say the photos are inconclusive and could be digitally altered.
